title: Search Insert Position
approach: Use binary search to find the correct insertion index

title: Group Anagrams
approach: Use a hash map to group anagrams by sorting or character count

title: Plus One
approach: Simulate the addition operation by iterating from the last digit

title: Set Matrix Zeroes
approach: Use the first row and first column to mark rows and columns to be zeroed

title: Search a 2D Matrix
approach: Perform binary search on the matrix

title: Power of Two
approach: Check if the number is greater than 0 and if it's a power of two using bit manipulation

title: Minimum Path Sum
approach: Use dynamic programming to calculate the minimum path sum from top-left to bottom-right

title: Subsets
approach: Use backtracking to generate all subsets

title: Combination Sum
approach: Use backtracking to find all combinations that sum up to the target

title: Letter Combinations of a Phone Number
approach: Use backtracking to generate letter combinations from digits

title: Permutations
approach: Use backtracking to generate all permutations of a list

title: Permutations II
approach: Use backtracking with pruning to generate unique permutations

title: Combination Sum II
approach: Use backtracking to generate all unique combinations that sum to the target

title: N-Queens
approach: Use backtracking to place queens on a chessboard such that no two queens attack each other

title: N-Queens II
approach: Use backtracking to count all possible solutions for the N-Queens problem

title: Sudoku Solver
approach: Use backtracking to solve the Sudoku puzzle

title: Word Search
approach: Use backtracking to search for words in the grid

title: Word Search II
approach: Use backtracking with Trie to search for multiple words in the grid

title: Unique Paths
approach: Use dynamic programming to find the number of unique paths in a grid

title: Unique Paths II
approach: Use dynamic programming to find the number of unique paths considering obstacles

title: Jump Game
approach: Use greedy approach or dynamic programming to determine if you can reach the last index

title: Jump Game II
approach: Use greedy approach to find the minimum number of jumps to reach the end

title: Minimum Path Sum
approach: Use dynamic programming to find the minimum path sum in a grid

title: Coin Change
approach: Use dynamic programming to find the minimum number of coins needed to make up a target amount

title: Coin Change II
approach: Use dynamic programming to find the number of ways to make change for a target amount

title: Target Sum
approach: Use dynamic programming or recursion with memoization to solve the target sum problem

title: Decode Ways
approach: Use dynamic programming to count the number of ways to decode a message

title: Decode Ways II
approach: Use dynamic programming to solve for the number of decoding ways with a twist on the problem

title: House Robber
approach: Use dynamic programming to solve the problem of maximizing the amount of money robbed

title: House Robber II
approach: Use dynamic programming with circular house arrangement handling

title: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock
approach: Use dynamic programming to track the maximum profit from buying and selling stock

title: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock II
approach: Use greedy approach to calculate maximum profit by buying and selling multiple times

title: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock III
approach: Use dynamic programming to solve for two transactions in the stock problem

title: Best Time to Buy and Sell Stock IV
approach: Use dynamic programming to solve for multiple transactions of stock buying and selling

title: Longest Increasing Subsequence
approach: Use dynamic programming or binary search to find the longest increasing subsequence

title: Longest Common Subsequence
approach: Use dynamic programming to find the longest common subsequence between two strings

title: Edit Distance
approach: Use dynamic programming to find the minimum number of operations to convert one string to another

title: Palindrome Substrings
approach: Use dynamic programming or expand-around-center to find palindromic substrings

title: Unique Binary Search Trees
approach: Use dynamic programming to count the number of unique binary search trees

title: Unique Binary Search Trees II
approach: Use dynamic programming and recursion to generate all unique BSTs

title: Minimum Window Substring
approach: Use sliding window technique to find the smallest substring containing all characters of a given string

title: Sliding Window Maximum
approach: Use deque to find the maximum value in each sliding window of size k

title: Longest Substring Without Repeating Characters
approach: Use sliding window and hash map to find the length of the longest substring without repeating characters

title: Minimum Size Subarray Sum
approach: Use sliding window to find the minimum length of a subarray with sum greater than or equal to the target

title: Group Anagrams
approach: Use hash map to group anagrams together

title: Sort Colors
approach: Use the Dutch National Flag algorithm to sort colors in linear time

title: Search in Rotated Sorted Array
approach: Use binary search to find the target in a rotated sorted array

title: Search in Rotated Sorted Array II
approach: Use binary search to find the target in a rotated sorted array with duplicates

title: Find Minimum in Rotated Sorted Array
approach: Use binary search to find the minimum element in a rotated sorted array

title: Find Peak Element
approach: Use binary search to find a peak element in the array
